meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction in which small molecules combine to form a larger molecule.
meanings.sent1: The ingredients polymerised together to create a strong adhesive.
meanings.sent2: The plastic bottles were polymerised to make a durable material.
meanings.sent3: The tiny beads polymerised into a giant ball, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas polymerised into a brilliant solution for the problem.
meanings.sent5: The colors polymerised into a beautiful painting on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into a polymer.
meanings.sent1: The raw materials polymerised during the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent2: The liquid polymerised into a solid substance when cooled.
meanings.sent3: The dough polymerised into a delicious loaf of bread in the oven.
meanings.sent4: His words polymerised into a heartfelt poem that touched many hearts.
meanings.sent5: The scattered pieces polymerised into a complete puzzle in her hands.
